content.description: A second pitch above Righteous are the Brave. From the anchors atop RATB step right and climb past a short step with a bolt. Follow more bolts up a short slot with a crack (crux) to a crawl around a corner. Move up through the final headwall crack jamming and pulling on loose looking blocks to the chains. Watch out for rat poop!
content.protection: bolts although it would take gear

content.description: A classic corner up a dihedral crack. Climb a small slab up to a thin crack, use face features and jams to work up towards a small roof. Fire the finish and end on a ledge with chain anchors. Longer than it looks in the picture, this is a quality route with great gear and good movement. A nice warm-up for the area, don't miss a lap on this one.
content.protection: A single set of cams and stoppers up to 3 inches, draws and runners.
content.location: Directly off the road at the 5th pullout. This is the obvious dihedral corner with a great belay platform.

content.description: Strenuous climbing characterized by some very poor holds and long moves. Step off ledge into off-balance layback section. Make big moves on bad holds to reach a nice rest at about midway. Move back left through crimpy terrain and finish with several long reaches between good holds.
content.protection: No bolts on route as of writing. Intention is to place two bolts down low and rely on small, tricky gear placements through second 2/3 of route. Bolted anchors can be reached by swinging around the corner from anchors of Surprise inside.
content.location: Just right of Surprise Inside on the Orange Face. Use same approach for both Orange Face Projects. It might not be a bad idea to follow the Ladyfingers approach to the top of the buttress and drop off the other side to avoid the scree pile upstream of Cutthroats Don't Wear Plaid.

content.description:
Area classic? Purportedly a broken hold may have upped the difficulty on this one at the upper crux; regardless, it feels stout for the grade.

Make some thin moves up vertical seams and sidepulls, occasionally using the arete to gain a large positive flake (don't pull out!). Rest up here, then fire the crux on terrible feet, using whatever you can find to pull up on to surmount a small overlap and gain juggy sidepulls that lead to the chains.
content.location: From Ladyfingers, the face/arete just up and around the corner to the right.

content.description: This is the bolted line directly to the left of Ladyfingers.  Climbs on small edges and side pulls.  Being able to crimp hard on small stuff will make this route more fun!
content.protection: Bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Toproped with some frequency after climbing Ladyfingers.
content.location: Just to the left of the Ladyfingers crack.

content.description: One of southwest Montana's nicest cracks despite its short length. Start with a short wider section that delivers you on a large ledge. From here, climb a brief section of hands and then enjoy the excellent tips and fingers crack (the crux), seeking out good feet outside the crack. Quite nice.
content.protection: Mostly fingers and tips (takes stoppers well). 1 or 2 hand sized. Maybe something wide for the initial bit, though it's short and protecting it might cause a bunch of drag. 2-bolt anchor on top.
content.location: Uphill and on the opposite side of the buttress from Righteous are the Brave. Very obvious splitter.

content.description: This enjoyable arete climb has lots of thin cracks and fun face movement.  The rests are huge...once you get to them.
content.protection: 1 bolt off the ground with small gear (<#1 Camelot) to protect the rest.
content.location: Located on the sharp arete near Righteous are the Brave.

content.description: A few easy but awkward moves take you to a small roof. Reach out left to a jug and pull thru the roof on crimps and side pulls. Continue straight up (It is possible, though not recommended, to scoot right at the third bolt to cop a rest among the choss.) until the climbing eases off and finish on big comfy holds.
content.location: Right hand line on the beautiful orange face around the corner to the right of Surprise Inside. Best approach is to climb Righteous are the Brave then traverse ledges and scree to ledge below the orange headwall. The alternative is a scramble up the horrendous scree pile to the right of Cutthroats Don't Wear Plaid.
